main event: Between the hours of 1430 and 1530 on 17 July 1949, in Pullman, Washington, a shiny white object resembling a halo was sighted. It appeared to be spinning end over end in a rapid easterly direction.
interesting points: The object was described as a halo spinning end over end and moving rapidly in an easterly direction.
Three men reported a similar incident a few days prior, describing a big, shiny object floating along toward the East in a rolling motion.
The observation lasted for about 5 minutes, and the object was believed to be very high in altitude.
The sighting was reported in a local newspaper, adding credibility to the event.
The wife of an associate professor of anthropology was the primary observer, adding credibility to the witness.
witnesses: wife of an associate professor of anthropology, and three other men
